segment.source: How to Deploy a MED-V Workspace in a Windows 7 Image
segment.target: How to Deploy a MED-V Workspace in a Windows 7 Image

segment.source: How to Deploy a MED-V Workspace in a Windows 7 Image
segment.target: How to Deploy a MED-V Workspace in a Windows 7 Image

segment.source: How to Deploy a MED-V Workspace in a Windows 7 Image
segment.target: How to Deploy a MED-V Workspace in a Windows 7 Image

segment.source: You can install all the MED-V components into a Windows 7 image that you distribute throughout your enterprise just as you would any new installation of Windows 7.
segment.target: You can install all the MED-V components into a Windows 7 image that you distribute throughout your enterprise just as you would any new installation of Windows 7.

segment.source: The end user then finishes the installation of the MED-V workspace by clicking a Start menu shortcut that you configure to start MED-V.
segment.target: The end user then finishes the installation of the MED-V workspace by clicking a Start menu shortcut that you configure to start MED-V.

segment.source: First time setup starts and the end user follows the instructions to complete the configuration.
segment.target: First time setup starts and the end user follows the instructions to complete the configuration.

segment.source: The following section provides information and instructions to help you deploy the MED-V workspace throughout your enterprise by using a Windows 7 image.
segment.target: The following section provides information and instructions to help you deploy the MED-V workspace throughout your enterprise by using a Windows 7 image.

segment.source: To deploy a MED-V workspace in a Windows 7 image
segment.target: To deploy a MED-V workspace in a Windows 7 image

segment.source: Create a standard image of Windows 7.
segment.target: Create a standard image of Windows 7.

segment.source: For more information, see Building a Standard Image of Windows 7: Step-by-Step Guide (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=204843).
segment.target: For more information, see Building a Standard Image of Windows 7: Step-by-Step Guide (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=204843).

segment.source: In the Windows 7 image, install Windows Virtual PC and the Windows Virtual PC updates.
segment.target: In the Windows 7 image, install Windows Virtual PC and the Windows Virtual PC updates.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Installation Prerequisites.

segment.source: Install the MED-V Host Agent by using the MED-VHostAgentSetup installation file.
segment.target: Install the MED-V Host Agent by using the MED-VHostAgentSetup installation file.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Manually Install the MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Internet Explorer must be closed before you install the MED-V Host Agent, otherwise conflicts can occur later with URL redirection.
segment.target: Internet Explorer must be closed before you install the MED-V Host Agent, otherwise conflicts can occur later with URL redirection.

segment.source: You can also do this by specifying a computer restart during a distribution.
segment.target: You can also do this by specifying a computer restart during a distribution.

segment.source: Copy the MED-V workspace package files to the Windows 7 image.
segment.target: Copy the MED-V workspace package files to the Windows 7 image.

segment.source: The MED-V workspace package files are the MED-V workspace installer, .medv file, and setup.exe file that you created by using the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace package files are the MED-V workspace installer, .medv file, and setup.exe file that you created by using the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The .medv and setup.exe file must be in the same folder as the MED-V workspace installer.
segment.target: The .medv and setup.exe file must be in the same folder as the MED-V workspace installer.

segment.source: Then, install the MED-V workspace by running setup.exe.
segment.target: Then, install the MED-V workspace by running setup.exe.

segment.source: Configure a shortcut on the Start menu to open the MED-V workspace package installation.
segment.target: Configure a shortcut on the Start menu to open the MED-V workspace package installation.

segment.source: Create a Start menu shortcut to the setup.exe file that lets the end user start a MED-V installation as required.
segment.target: Create a Start menu shortcut to the setup.exe file that lets the end user start a MED-V installation as required.

segment.source: By using your company’s standard image deployment process, distribute the Windows 7 image to computers in your enterprise that require MED-V.
segment.target: By using your company’s standard image deployment process, distribute the Windows 7 image to computers in your enterprise that require MED-V.

segment.source: When the end user has to access an application published in the MED-V workspace, they can click the Start menu shortcut to install the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: When the end user has to access an application published in the MED-V workspace, they can click the Start menu shortcut to install the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: This automatically starts first time setup and completes the configuration of MED-V.
segment.target: This automatically starts first time setup and completes the configuration of MED-V.

segment.source: After first time setup is complete, the end user can access the MED-V applications on the Start menu.
segment.target: After first time setup is complete, the end user can access the MED-V applications on the Start menu.

segment.target: Related topics
